meanings.sent1: I wore my sorels to keep my feet warm in the snow.
meanings.sent2: Her sorels were lined with cozy fur to protect her from the cold.
meanings.sent3: The sorels looked like little cabins for her feet.
meanings.sent4: His sorels were like shields against the icy ground.
meanings.sent5: The bright red sorels stood out in the white snow.

meanings.definition: Plural form of the word 'sorel', referring to a young horse.
meanings.sent1: The farmer had a group of sorels grazing in the field.
meanings.sent2: The sorels frolicked playfully in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The sorels seemed to be having a race around the paddock.
meanings.sent4: The young sorels galloped freely under the sunny sky.
meanings.sent5: The sorels' energy was contagious as they ran around.

meanings.definition: A type of plant in the genus Rumex.
meanings.sent1: The sorels grew abundantly near the riverbank.
meanings.sent2: The leaves of the sorels were used in salads for their tangy flavor.
meanings.sent3: The sorels in the garden seemed to be whispering to each other.
meanings.sent4: The sorels swayed gently in the breeze, like a green sea.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant color of the sorels brightened up the garden.
